title: Thunderbird continually asking for Passwords but won't accep or save them
content: I've used Thunderbird (TB) for years and have never been asked for a password until about two weeks ago. Tb is now contually requesting password but it won't accept or save them. I've uninstalled my TB program and reinstalled the latest, but the problem still persists. I've now got emails on the virginmedia server that I can't download to TB. I'm an 89 year old and am at my withs end. I use Windows 11, Tb and Virgin Media as my ISP. Please is ther some one out there who can solve this proble?
creator: Alan2592

title: Mozilla Emails unable to send or receive
content:
Thunderbird problem: The system was fully operational on 2nd June but nothing available on my Main PC in my office. Incoming Emails and outgoing Emails are not working on two of my accounts with AOL and one Gmail account. The cursor wheel continuously revolves if I attempt to view incoming messages for each of the accounts.

I have attempted to adjust the security settings but this did not work. I need my office PC to be able to respond and print out urgent info.

My main office Email address has nothing in the in-box whereas my mobile phone version is fully populated and functional.

Please advise best solution without having to reinstall Thunderbird My email addresses are: beronworth@aol.com , rdb57home@aol.com & robertburch54@outlook.com
creator: beronworth

title: Lost emails & other issues after upgrade to Thunderbird 114.0b6 (64-bit)
content:
Hi, Having just upgraded to Thunderbird 114.0b6 (64-bit), I seem to have lost the vast majority of my email messages and no longer have a unified folder.

I had/have several email accounts. Most were POP, so before upgrading, I changed them all to IMAP.

I then installed the new version. This did not pick up my existing Thunderbird profile (which is on my D drive), so I imported my old profile from the D drive. This did not import the server settings, so I reconfigured them for each account.

For some reason, only a small minority of my old email messages seem to have been imported, the oldest going back as far as 2015. The vast majority are missing.

I received an email message a couple of days ago (via my new Thunderbirds installation), but it is no longer visible in the Inbox of the account that received it. If I search for the message, it shows up, but I cannot find or access the email itself.

Additional to these problems, I cannot view all my emails in a unified folder. I select the Unified Folders option from meatball menu, top left - Folder Modes, but nothing changes and when I re-enter the menu it is unchecked. Likewise, if I go - main menu/View/Folders/ and check Unified, it does nothing and does not remain checked.

I've read all the available documentation and watched the YouTube Folder Panes video, but found no solution.

I would be very grateful for any assistance you can offer.

Regards, David
creator: online34

title: Turn Off Threads ver 102.11.2
content:
Hello, I am a current user that is pretty familiar with Thunderbird and how it had worked with previous versions. I had just installed 102.11.2 to a new computer and have been able to customize mostly - but still am not able to remove threads like previous versions.

There is a view/unview, thread option - but it does not remove the actual threading into multiple messages.

Any suggestions?

thanks!
creator: kristoff67

title: Message filters do not run automatically
content:
(After the hacker attack we had to restore the encrypted mail from an older backup) The IMAP profile has been restored from backup, msgFilterRules.dat set as before backup, but incoming mail subject to filters remains in INBOX. But when manually running any filter, it moves particular message to the target folder. I've searched dozen of messages at support.mozilla.org for relevant topics, but my problem is not described.

The pattern of the rule that does not work: name="[rule name]" enabled="yes" type="17" action="Move to folder" actionValue="imap://account.name@mail.domain.cz/INBOX/existing destination folder" condition="AND (all addresses,contains,name@domain.cz) AND (all addresses,doesn't contain,my.name)"

All my colleagues on the same domain, with IMAP accounts, have this problem. TB 102.11.2 (64-bit) WIN 10

Is there any help? Thanks for the advice.
creator: ms16

title: Filtry zpráv po bnovení IMAP profilu nefungují automaticky
content:
(Po napadení hackerem jsme zašifrovanou poštu museli obnovit ze starší zálohy) Profil IMAP byl obnoven ze zálohy, msgFilterRules.dat nastaven stejně jako před zálohou, ale příchozí pošta, která podléhá filtrům zůstává v INBOX. Ale při manuálním spuštění kteréhokoli filtru se přesune do požadované složky. Prošel jsem support.mozilla.org na příslušná témata, ale pomoc jsem nenašel.

vzor pravidla které nefunguje: name="[název pravidla]" enabled="yes" type="17" action="Move to folder" actionValue="imap://název.účtu@mail.doména.cz/INBOX/existující cílová složka" condition="AND (all addresses,contains,jméno@doména.cz) AND (all addresses,doesn't contain,moje.jmeno)"

Tento problém mají všichni moji kolegové na stejné doméně, s účty v IMAP. TB 102.11.2 (64-bit) WIN 10

Je nám pomoci? Díky za radu.

title: Impossibile fare update di Thunderbird 102.11.1 (64bit)
content: Ho il seguente problema con Thunderbird: fino alla settimana scorsa il mio Thunderbird 102.11.1 (64bit) faceva regolarmente gli updates non appena disponibili (in realtà li facevo io manualmente). Da quando si é reso disponibile l'update 102.11.2 quando provo ad eseguirlo il programma fa partire l'aggiornamento, nel popup dice "Installazione aggiornamento" con tanto di circolino che gira come se stesse facendo qualcosa ma non succede niente; rimane così per sempre fino a quando io chiudo il popup. Ho anche provato a disabilitare il firewall, e a cancellare la cache ma niente. OS Windows 11 Pro.

title: Replacing my Retiring Account with Gmail
content:
My waitrose.com EMAP account with Plusnet is closing. I intend to replace it with gmail.com, which I previously established to support a mobile phone that I can no longer easily use for particular reasons and which I have now also installed into Windows 10 on my PC.

I envisage retiring my old account, whilst retain the complete 'Local Folders' Waitrose structure for reference and historical reasons, assuming that Gmail will establish separate storage to it's own rules, below (or above?) my history.

Is this a reasonable prospect and can you clarify if Gmail will take over my existing Inbox - Drafts - Sent - Junk and Deleted folders to it's use? Or will Gmail install a separate enviroment to it's own design and function?

And will Tbird continue to include my history folder-set along with the new, in the regular Profile Backups?
creator: peetrobo

title: Address Book name entries matching when composing emails
content:
I just imported my Google Contacts into Thunderbird (102.11.2) Address book. I verified that entries contain a first name, last name, and one or more email addresses. Yet when I try to address an email within Thunderbird WRITE dialog by entering a few letters in the 'TO' field, all that shows up are email addresses that match....no names. In other words, if I type 'John Jones', only email addresses that happen to have those letters appear; not the entry for John Jones that contains his email address.

Do I not have some setting set correctly, or is this a limitation that matching only occurs within the email address itself (which i hope is not the case).
creator: AndyDS

I cannot find information or previous questions addressing this issue so I would appreciate any suggestions. The ZIP folder is smaller than 2GB.

creator: drhammont

title: Using local folders to archive emails
content:
My main email account is with my internet provider and the storage available is unlimited. I have three other accounts with external hosts whose storage capacity is limited. Each email account is for a specific purpose. I am using IMAP setting for all email accounts. What I hoped I could do is set up folders in Local folders for each of the limited storage capacity accounts to direct the emails I want to save using the Message Filters. Not only did it not work, it wiped out the message filters that had been working well for me for ages. My message filter page is completely blank.

Being somewhat non-literal, I only recently learned that Local Folders really did mean folders on my hard drive. So wondering what else I don't know, what happens to the emails I archive. Are the emails still on the mail server? Or are archives on my hard drive? If the archives are on my hard drive and not on the remote mail server drive, are the emails there permanently - i.e., they're there until I delete them, or until something goes wrong with my hard drive? (Why would anyone think that might happen?)

If the archives are no longer at the mail server, but are on my hard drive - that would seem to solve my problem. I thought of the idea of moving emails to the Local Folders because I thought that archiving did not take the emails off the mail server.

If someone can make sense of all this so I don't stress myself out over what can go where, I will greatly appreciate it. :-}
creator: bdjim

title: cartelle unificate moltiplicate
content: Buongiorno, nella vista cartelle unificate ho quelle dei vari account moltiplicate, sono passato da outlook a thunderbird proprio per la cartella unificata, si può risolvere il problema?
creator: isidoro1976

title: Thunderbird adds me as an attendee  to my own event on a Google calendar whenever I edit it after I create it.
content:
If I create an event in a Google calendar in Thunderbird 102.11.2 and the Provider for Google Calendar, it correctly shows me as the organizer with no attendees. The Google Calendar app on my Samsung A13 phone running Android 12 shows it correctly on my calendar. If I then edit the event in Thunderbird and save it (even it I don't make changes), I am listed as an attendee to the meeting as well as the organizer. This causes my phone to show the event with a black interior rather than the normal color for events on my calendar. My presumption is that the black interior means the event hasn't been confirmed by all attendees. If I "remove all attendees" in Thunderbird for the event, my phone shows it correctly again.

I saw a similar problem report on the web about Google adding the organizer as an attendee. It said something about being logged in to "the primary" calendar when creating the event on a google calendar, but with no explanation about what the "primary calendar" is, and the description of that problem isn't exactly what is happening to me.

Removing all attendees or just living with different colored events on my calendar are viable options, but it is annoying. Any suggestions would be welcome.
creator: gsem66

title: segítség thunderbirdben emailek fogadásának  visszaállításához
content:
Jó reggelt!

Thunderbirdben használt emailcímem (lillaeinstein@t-email.hu) napok óta nem működik.A program betölt ,de új emailek fogadása , valamiért nem lehetséges (tárhely nincs tele ).Többször indítottam újra a gépet,a programot,de semmi változás.Mintha elkezdődne a letöltés,de egy idő után kiírja,hogy a kapcsolódás túllépte a maximális várakozási időt és nem történik semmi.Sajnos több hivatalos helyen is ez az emailcímem van megadva,jó lenne,ha működésre tudnám bírni.

creator: szikszaikatalinemese

title: Sort emails by star and then newest date on top no longer works in Beta v.114
content: My email inbox was always sorted by star and then date, with all my starred emails first at the top followed by newest emails second at the top. I have just switched to Thunderbird Beta v114 with the unified inbox folder for all my email accounts and cannot get the inbox to sort this way. I can have the newest emails at the top without the starred emails, but as soon as I put the starred emails at the top all the other emails are sorted in reverse, that is, oldest at the top. I can get the exact opposite of the arrangement I want by putting the starred emails at the foot and then the newest emails, so the oldest emails are at the top. I cannot find any way to reproduce the sort order I always used before moving to v.114.
creator: joe105
